oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee Farmer title and index pages
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture
Agriculture; Horticulture; Periodicals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Title and index pages from the "Tennessee Farmer," edited by Thomas Emmerson.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Emmerson, Thomas, 1773-1837, Deaderick, J.F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Judge Thomas Emmerson established the "Tennessee Farmer" in December, 1834, as a monthly agricultural journal that he called the first attempt at such a magazine in Tennessee. Prior to this, Emmerson, fellow attorney Seth J.W. Lucky, and publisher Lawson Gifford operated the Washington Republican and Farmer's Journal from 1832 to 1837. Emmerson, a native of Virginia, became the first mayor of Knoxville, a Supreme Court judge, and collaborated with John Overton on the first two volumes of TennesseeReports.
